Reviews.Title: Really is an awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: W. D. Mindock "stargazer"
Reviews.Content: It is built like a tank.Turns on and is up and running about as quick you'll ever need. Turning off the boot up image in settings helps.It focuses very quickly.Many options are available. Be ready to spend a week, to master them all. Camera isa lot of fun to use. The more time you spend reading the manual, on the CD, the more you'll be impressed with it. It even has a built-in level and in-camera HDR. Lots of other goodies as well.Picture quality is better than I have ever seen from a point & shoot. It can shoot in RAW mode,Shoots photos in fairly dark rooms without the flash. My top of the line Elph always had trouble but not the G15. The lens istop notch, very fast.

Reviews.Title: Amazing point and shoot for photography enthusiasts
Reviews.Author: Richie Deschamps
Reviews.Content: If you're a photography enthusiast, and you're looking for a solid point and shoot camera to carry around when you don't want to lug a ton of equipment on your back, this is the camera to buy. I don't think there is a point and shoot in this price range that has a lens this fast, particularly one that maintains a f/2.8 while zoomed to its maximum focal range. A lot of reviews compare this camera with Sony's RX100 -- a camera that arguably has a better sensor -- but even that camera has a minimum aperture of 4.0 when zoomed to its maximum focal range.I primarily shoot in low light situations, concert photography to be specific, so it's important that I'm able to get good results with fast moving objects in dim lighting environments. I tested this out last night at a show where the only lights were coming from a projectionist who was projecting onto a band. Amazingly, I was able to get great shots that rival some DSLR bodies I've owned in the past. Still no match for what I get with my Sony a65, but certainly impressive considering that this is a point and shoot! Even at an ISO of 1600, there is little noticeable noise and great bokeh behind your subjects.I haven't seen it mentioned in many reviews, but the video feature is also very impressive for a point and shoot. While I've noticed other reviews say that it is "limited" to 24 frames per second while in 1080p mode (if you shoot at 720p, it shoots at 30 fps), I literally NEVER shoot video UNLESS it's at a frame rate of 24 fps. It gives your video a very cinematic feel, and people tend to perceive video shot this way to look more professional. However, you can't control shutter speed, ISO, focus or aperture while shooting video, something that I can't help but wonder why not... maybe a firmware update is in the works. If that's the case, I could see this camera becoming a DSLR alternative for video enthusiasts.Although you're not going to achieve the same results with this camera as you would with a good DSLR, this little camera is a great addition to my collection, and I'm very happy with the results I've achieved so far. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: SLR substitute
Reviews.Author: Slamron
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon D600 with a tele and a 50mm lens. With the bag it ways almost 4 lbs, way too much to haul it around during sight seeing. I bought the G15 because of its fast lense, reasonable zoom range, some of the manual settings posibilities and its fairly light weight. The pros: light weight, very good pictures in low light conditions, good white balance, reasonable distortion. The cons: it is borderline portable in my trouser pocket, the flash opens up only manually, the optical tunnel view finder is only approximate but useful in bright light. Manual settings not as easy and extensive as on my D600.Overall, it is the best point and shoot camera I ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Great camera--good bundle.
Reviews.Author: windbreaker
Reviews.Content: I got this G15 to have a good quality camera that has a fast lens and a lot of flexibility that I can take on hikes and runs in the local forests. It's very portable and fairly light at .75 lb. and  can be up and taking quality photos very quickly.

Reviews.Title: really nice
Reviews.Author: vlklng6
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera, but with high quality results.  I'm normally used to low priced point and shooters, but was looking for higher quality pictures.  The G15 did not disappoint.  I took very high quality pictures, and very high quality movies.  I'm extremely pleased with this camera and I highly recommend it to anyone that's not a professional photographer, but wants high quality images.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot G15
Reviews.Author: jackie
Reviews.Content: I lost one just like this through a move.  Had to have another so bought it again.  Enjoy the camera.  Like the compact size and light weight. Great pics!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have so much enjoyed my camera.  It is easy to use and takes great pictures.  No quite pocket sized but small enough to easily fit into a purse.  I bought a small pouch recommended by another reviewer:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0023EXKO4/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1 and softer strap: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002YVRGPA/ref=oh_details_o01_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1both of which  I highly recommend.  Do not waste your time with additional lenses, they are worthless.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Bullis
Reviews.Content: The camera is great.  The construction of the camera is very strong and durable.  Also takes great pictures and videos.  Still learning all the various settings.

Reviews.Title: a great little camera
Reviews.Author: Shelli laFlamme
Reviews.Content: ..the g15 is an excellent point/shoot...u can use the auto all the time which takes wonderful clear photos or  access manual and set your own light or shutter settings....macro takes amazing shots....the camera is light to carry...still difficult to c screen in sun however the view finder is available...

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: J Davis
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a number of months now and can report that I am very happy with its performance. It took a little time for me to figure out which settings work best for the conditions I shoot in, but it was worth the time it took to test it out. I am very satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: My new best camera ever
Reviews.Author: N.B.V.
Reviews.Content: Love the quality of my photos with my new Canon G15.  It came with a group of accessories also.  I use my photos to paint from, so quality is important, but also size as I frequently take images of people in their natural environment and not posed so I have to be a bit "sneaky".  It is going on a painting trip to Italy with me.  My new best companion.

Reviews.Title: Great buy... great gift
Reviews.Author: Eric Davis "www.DJOneTyMe.com"
Reviews.Content: My wife loved it as a gift. It had everything she needed. She actually had picked it out... I just cut the check lol

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but wasn't what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: MominAK
Reviews.Content: I should start off by saying that the G15 is a nice camera and will take better-than-average point and shoot photos. It has a good zoom range and the shoe for auxiliary flash is a nice bonus. If you're looking to replace an older camera, or buying this as a first camera for yourself or someone else, you wont be disappointed. It's built really well and has a few features that you wont find on other point and shoots.However, I ended up returning it as it just wasn't what I was looking for. I currently own a Canon Powershot ELPH, and a Rebel T3i. We love our t3i which is an awesome camera that takes amazing photos. The only problem is that it's too big to carry around as an everyday camera so we've missed out on capturing special moments and memories because we didn't want to lug the extra bag worth of equipment. We have the ELPH for that, but after seeing the difference in photo quality, its just hard to get excited about using it. I was hoping the G15 would narrow the gap between size/convenience and photo quality, but ended up being disappointed. The G15 took some nice photos in the time we tested it, but only a handful that were noticeably better than what the ELPH would have produced. And while it's small enough to fit in a large purse or backpack, it's still too big to fit in a jeans pocket or smaller purse(which is what my wife prefers). For the price it just didn't live up to what we expected, and if you're looking for a convenient point and shoot, I think your money would be better spent on something like the S110 or even the ELPH 330 (the upgraded version of what we own).

Reviews.Title: Diggin it!
Reviews.Author: Wendie Thompson
Reviews.Content: I am loving everything about this camera! It is a step up from my old PowerShot SX110IS as it allows me to now take raw images. (required for images of my own art)

Reviews.Title: The camera arrived quickly and well
Reviews.Author: Margarita Dueñas
Reviews.Content: I choose this ranking for the price. I liked the camera, at the moment all it's o.k. I need some more of time for test works well

Reviews.Title: Just what I expected.  Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: M. E. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews, I chose this camera.  The additional items that came in the bundle were an added plus.  The price was great and it made the decision easy.  This camera's image quality outperforms my previous everyday digital pocket camera.  Having a movie capability is even better.  Still a "pocket" camera but easier to manage than others I have owned due to to thickness and surface texture.  While not a DSLR, it sure beats the bulk and weight and suits my needs.  Great value!

Reviews.Title: Powershot G15
Reviews.Author: D. Miller "music lover"
Reviews.Content: For a while now, I've been wanting a compact digital that would shoot RAW, one to use for times when my DSLR is too cumbersome to lug around.  The G15 is a great solution.  It does indeed shoot RAW if you want that (but you can shoot three grades of JPEG, also), but it does a whole lot more, as well.  It's the next best thing to a DSLR.  In fact, it does things my 6-year-old DSLR does not, employing a number of advances in digital photography that have occurred over that interim.  For example, it shoots five aspect ratios, where my DSLR shoots only two.  It doesn't exactly replace a DSLR, but it's a very nice alternative for times when you don't want to carry a big camera.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT G15 12 MP DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: ROBERT E. PENCAK
Reviews.Content: I SHOT A FEW HUNDRED PICTURES THUS FAR, TRYING DIFFERENT LIGHTING AND THE CAMERAS CREATIVE FEATURES AND I AM PLEASED WITH THE RESULTS . VERY GOOD VERY LOW LIGHT PERFORMANCE.

Reviews.Title: Best, lightweight camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amy Alpeza
Reviews.Content: Slim, power packed camera for even a novice photographer! Amazing photos, tons of options without being overwhelming, and BEST price! Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Bundle!!
Reviews.Author: Ruchel Ruttner
Reviews.Content: I was always wishing for this camera. (I did tons of research and this won all the time.) When it was on sale on Cyber Monday I couldn't keep back, and bought it. Still figuring out the settings, but the picture quality is super duper! And all the accesories that come with it, I got a bargain for my money!!If you are into photography, and are looking for the best camera for a decent price, go with the G15!

Reviews.Title: It's a great camera
Reviews.Author: Silversmith "jimbove"
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of searching and review reading before deciding to go with the G15.  We are not let down.  This camera is simply the best in its class.  It is so easy to use and is capable of so much.  I did have to spend some time with the manual for the more complex shots I wanted to do, but after reading the easy to understand instructions, I had my custom light balance programed into one of the selections on the top dial (C1 and C2 are fully customizable settings- love this feature!) and now I just set the camera to that everytime we do a shoot under those conditions.When we looked at the cameras in person, many of the competitors cameras felt cheap and one more expensive camera had 3/4 of its monitor fried.  The sales person said it was a display model and they get abused, but we felt that was not a good sign, we want something that can handle travel.  This Canon definitely can take a lot.We love it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot G15 12MP
Reviews.Author: GLD
Reviews.Content: Have had the camera for several months and I'm still learning to use it fully. Very easy to place on "auto" and take photos quickly . Has advanced features for camera buffs. Will fit into a purse but not really small enough to carry around in a pocket for extended periods of time. Battery life is good and the photos are excellent . Video is easy to use and stays in focus vs. other cameras that I've owned in the past. A reasonable value for the money . Overall I am extremely pleased with the camera and would highly recommend it for general photographic/video use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Mohsin Habib
Reviews.Content: Clear, crisp picture, both indoor and outdoor. Light, easy to carry and easy to operate. Great for amateurs like me.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Netters
Reviews.Content: I am just a beginner and have taken some beautiful photos with this camera. Highly recommend!!! Small, yet great quality camera!

Reviews.Title: I upgraded from the G10 to the G15 and so far I am not impress
Reviews.Author: Yukiko D. Franco
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera for Christmas. I had been very happy with the G10 and wanted to upgrade.  The G15 change functions and wording and its  hard to find  some of the features and functions -- menu more complicated.  I am having trouble getting great shots with the G15. The photos are  either over expose or underexpose.  The Auto function does not seem to work  very well.  I take a lot of action shots... I am very disappointed  with  the performance of the  G15.  Canon -- you had a great product in the G10. Why did you change it for the worse.  when I upgraded I was expecting  same camera with more features and better quality photos,  not worse.  You may need to go back to the drawing board.  For now I am considering going back to my old G10 and maybe getting a new  Nikon camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: Bruce E. Forsberg "Bruce Forsberg"
Reviews.Content: Only one little bump in the order process, but Beach Camera came through with flying colors!I'm loving the Canon G15.

ProductInfo.Name: Canon Powershot G15 12 MP High-Performance Digital Camera 32GB Bundle
